org.dkpro.statistics.agreement

Class AnnotationStudy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dkpro.statistics.agreement.AnnotationStudy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAnnotationStudy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CodingAnnotationStudy, UnitizingAnnotationStudy

    public abstract class AnnotationStudy
extends Object
implements IAnnotationStudy
    Default implementation of the IAnnotationStudy interface. Abstract base class for coding and unitizing annotation studies.
    Author:
    Christian M. Meyer

      Adds the given category to the set of possible annotation labels.

      Add a rater with the given name.

      Find the index of the rater with the given name.
      Iterable<Object> getCategories()
      Returns an iterator over all annotation categories within the study.
      int getCategoryCount()
      Returns the number of annotation categories in the study.
      int getRaterCount()
      Returns the number of raters participating in this study.
      boolean isDichotomous()
      Returns true if, and only if, the categories defined by the study yield a dichotomy (i.e., there are exactly two categories).

    • Method Detail

      • addRater

        public int addRater(String name)
        Add a rater with the given name. Returns the index of the newly added rater which is required to identify the rater in IAnnotationUnit. The first rater receives index 0. Note that adding names for the raters is optional.

      • findRater

        public int findRater(String name)
        Find the index of the rater with the given name.

      • getRaterCount

        public int getRaterCount()
        Description copied from interface: IAnnotationStudy
        Returns the number of raters participating in this study.
        Specified by:
        getRaterCount in interface IAnnotationStudy

      • addCategory

        public void addCategory(Object category)
        Adds the given category to the set of possible annotation labels. This method is only required of a category has not been used by any rater of within the annotation study.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified category is null.

      • getCategories

        public Iterable<Object> getCategories()
        Description copied from interface: IAnnotationStudy
        Returns an iterator over all annotation categories within the study. Note that the categories are not per se clear; they might need to be gathered by iterating through all associated items, which yields performance problems in large-scale annotation studies.
        Specified by:
        getCategories in interface IAnnotationStudy

      • getCategoryCount

        public int getCategoryCount()
        Description copied from interface: IAnnotationStudy
        Returns the number of annotation categories in the study. Note that the categories are not per se clear; they might need to be gathered by iterating through all associated items, which yields performance problems in large-scale annotation studies.
        Specified by:
        getCategoryCount in interface IAnnotationStudy

      • isDichotomous

        public boolean isDichotomous()
        Description copied from interface: IAnnotationStudy
        Returns true if, and only if, the categories defined by the study yield a dichotomy (i.e., there are exactly two categories).
        Specified by:
        isDichotomous in interface IAnnotationStudy
